events.originalText: The Marine Parade Community Building, the mural cladding of which is the largest installation art in Singapore, was opened.
events.subtitle: Marine Parade Community Building
events.headline: Marine Parade Community Building with Largest Installation Art in Singapore Opened

events.originalText: The Troubles: In Operation Flavius, the Special Air Service killed three volunteers of the Provisional Irish Republican Army conspiring to bomb a parade of British military bands in Gibraltar.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Operation Flavius: SAS Kills IRA Volunteers Plotting Bombing in Gibraltar

events.originalText: The ferry Herald of Free Enterprise capsized while leaving the harbour of Zeebrugge, Belgium, killing 193 people on board.
events.subtitle: MS Herald of Free Enterprise
events.headline: Ferry Herald of Free Enterprise Capsizes in Zeebrugge, Belgium, 193 Dead

events.originalText: In a radio broadcast, Nation of Islam leader Elijah Muhammad announced that American boxer Cassius Clay would change his name to Muhammad Ali (pictured).
events.subtitle: Nation of Islam
events.headline: Elijah Muhammad Announces Cassius Clay Name Change to Muhammad Ali

events.originalText: Following Joseph Stalin's death, Georgy Malenkov succeeded him as Premier of the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Joseph Stalin
events.headline: Georgy Malenkov Succeeds Stalin as Premier of Soviet Union

events.originalText: Petru Groza of the Ploughmen's Front became the first prime minister of the Communist Party-dominated government of Romania.
events.subtitle: Petru Groza
events.headline: Petru Groza Becomes First Communist Prime Minister of Romania

events.originalText: World War II: National Liberation Front forces defeated Italian occupiers in the Battle of Fardykambos, a major sign of the Greek resistance's growth.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: National Liberation Front Defeats Italian Occupiers in Battle of Fardykambos

events.originalText: The day after the federal election, the Nazi Party banned elected Communist Party of Germany members from taking their seats in the Reichstag.
events.subtitle: March 1933 German federal election
events.headline: Nazi Party Bans Communist Members from Reichstag After Election

events.originalText: Organized by the Communist International, hundreds of thousands of people in major cities around the world marched to protest mass unemployment associated with the Great Depression.
events.subtitle: Communist International
events.headline: Global Protests Against Mass Unemployment Organized by Communist International

events.originalText: First Balkan War: The Greek army captured Bizani Fortress, near Ioannina, from the Ottomans.
events.subtitle: First Balkan War
events.headline: Greek Army Captures Bizani Fortress from Ottomans in First Balkan War

events.originalText: Scottish National Antarctic Expedition: Led by William Speirs Bruce, the Antarctic region of Coats Land was discovered from the Scotia.
events.subtitle: Scottish National Antarctic Expedition
events.headline: Antarctic Region of Coats Land Discovered by Scottish Expedition

events.originalText: Giuseppe Verdi's La traviata premiered at La Fenice in Venice, but the performance was considered so bad that it caused him to revise portions of the opera.
events.subtitle: Giuseppe Verdi
events.headline: La traviata Premiere in Venice Prompts Verdi to Revise Opera

events.originalText: Texas Revolution: Mexican troops captured the Alamo Mission in San Antonio from Texian forces after a 13-day siege.
events.subtitle: Texas Revolution
events.headline: Mexican Troops Capture Alamo Mission from Texian Forces in Texas Revolution

events.originalText: Tomaso Parentucelli became Pope Nicholas V.
events.subtitle: Pope Nicholas V
events.headline: Tomaso Parentucelli Elected as Pope Nicholas V

events.originalText: The Abbasid Caliphate executed 42 Byzantine officials who had been captured in the Sack of Amorium of 838 for refusing to convert to Islam.
events.subtitle: Abbasid Caliphate
events.headline: Abbasid Caliphate Executes 42 Byzantine Officials for Refusing to Convert to Islam
